intro: Melampyrum jedoense var. luxurians, commonly known as the Japanese touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it derives some of its nutrients from the roots of neighboring plants. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
